docs.snippet: Valery Panov, the former star of the Kirov ballet whose emigration from the Soviet Union to Israel has been blocked by the refusal of Soviet authorities to grant an exit visa to his wife Galina, was formally notified
docs.lead_paragraph: Valery Panov, the former star of the Kirov ballet whose emigration from the Soviet Union to Israel has been blocked by the refusal of Soviet authorities to grant an exit visa to his wife Galina, was formally notified
docs.abstract: Valery Panov formally notified on May 24 that he has been stripped of his title as 'honored artist' of the USSR; repts his wife, expected to deliver their first child in a few months, 'has no strength left' and has been urging him to go to Israel alone; says he cannot leave her (S)

headline.main: Soviet Strips Panovof 'HonoredArtist' Title; Notes on People

docs.snippet: The Argentine police arrested 98 Uruguayan political exiles last night while they were meeting to organize a protest demonstation against the militarycontrolled government in Uruguay.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Argentine police arrested 98 Uruguayan political exiles last night while they were meeting to organize a protest demonstation against the militarycontrolled government in Uruguay.
docs.abstract: Argentine police arrest 98 Uruguyan pol exiles as they are meeting to organize protest demonstration against mil controlled govt in Uruguay in what appears to be part of harassment campaign against pol refugees from neighboring Latin-Amer countries; meeting called by Com of Uruguayan Residents to discuss planned rally against Govt; Argentine orgns concerned with rights of pol refugees met to warn that traditional practice of pol asylum in Uruguay is endangered (S)

headline.main: 98 Foes of Uruguayan Regime Seized in Argentine Police Raid; Meeting Publicly Announced A Warning on Rights

byline.original: By JONATHAN KANDELLSpecial to The New York Times

docs.snippet: NEWARK. - "Americanborn children travel throughout the world just by walking the halls of Mount Vernon school," says Anthony D'Agostino, principal of what must be one of the most unusual schools in Newark, if not the state.
docs.lead_paragraph: NEWARK. - "Americanborn children travel throughout the world just by walking the halls of Mount Vernon school," says Anthony D'Agostino, principal of what must be one of the most unusual schools in Newark, if not the state.
docs.abstract: article on Mount Vernon elementary school, Newark, NJ, where about half of students were born in some 36 different nations; school serves children of diplomats, drs, immigrant families, profs and foreign exch students, many of them attached to nearby hosps and univs; special English language instruction noted; principal Anthony D'Agostino comments; students illus (M)

headline.main: School Mirrors the World; The Buddy System
